The "golden hour" and "blue hour" are terms that refer to the periods of time around sunrise and sunset when the natural light is particularly warm and soft.

The golden hour, also known as the magic hour, is the period of time shortly after sunrise or before sunset when the sun is low in the sky and the light has a warm, golden color. The golden hour is often considered the best time for photography and videography, as the soft, warm light can create beautiful, flattering images.

The blue hour, on the other hand, is the period of time shortly after sunset or before sunrise when the sky is lit by the remaining light of the sun, which can give the sky a deep blue color. The blue hour is also a popular time for photography and videography, as the soft, blue light can create a moody, atmospheric look.

So, in summary, the golden hour and blue hour are periods of time around sunrise and sunset when the natural light is particularly soft and warm (golden hour) or cool and blue (blue hour). These times are often considered ideal for photography and videography, as they can create beautiful, atmospheric images.
